The past two days have been pretty amazing at the AAED Fall Forum. The Arizona Regional Economic Development Foundation  received the Golden Prospectors Award.

My sixth year volunteering for CourtWorks and it was another big success! Awesome to see 300 middle schoolers come to the US Federal District Courthouse to argue NJ v TLO - and find out the cool kids go to law school (or at least lawyers think so).
Candidate for Superintendent of Public Instruction

BASIS.ed serves as the Education Management Organization for the BASIS charter schools, BASIS Independent Schools, and BASIS Global schools. BASIS schools, which serve grades K-12, have been ranked consistently among the best in the United States, and worldwide. As Director, New School Development, I coordinated all aspects of the company's plans to open new charter schools across the country. I conducted research on new markets, met with local officials and community members, identified and purchased real estate, produced financial projections, coordinated tax-exempt bond issuances for construction projects averaging $11MM apiece, provided major support in construction management including selection of architects and general contractors, planned and ran public meetings, helped coordinate marketing campaigns, and provided key input in strategic planning for company growth.I managed the opening of 15 campuses since joining BASIS. As of fall 2017, these schools will serve more than 8,000 students in Arizona and 2,500 in Texas, comprising 65 percent of the entire BASIS network.

Window Rock purchases distressed residential whole loans and repositions them to become valuable, cash-flowing assets. Through principal reductions, payment plans and government assistance programs, Window Rock has helped hundreds of borrowers become current on their mortgages and regain equity in their homes. I served as the lead underwriter for all firm acquisitions, producing detailed financial projections and conducting risk scenario testing to evaluate the attractiveness of every deal that came before the firm. I also built several technical tools for the company, including an automated valuation model (AVM) for distressed housing, a loan modification calculator, and a web-based data aggregator and standardization platform for incoming loan deals.

I planned and executed all elements of the fixmyschool.net website, from marketing and copywriting to graphic design, backend coding and server configuration. Tools used: Django (Python), jQuery, Photoshop, Illustrator, ApacheI also interviewed 90 principals, superintendents, teachers, politicians, researchers, and non-profit leaders in Arizona and Finland to become knowledgeable about education reform efforts in Arizona and Finnish best practices in education. Visited schools in Helsinki, Jyväskylä, and Lahti, Finland.
Wrote three chapters of a major report on radioactive materials in Mexico using extensive Spanish-language resources

recommendations: December 29, 2012, Jonathan was a client of Paul’s

I was the business manager for the Stanford yearbook in 2010 when we hired Lauren Studios for our fall 2010 senior pictures. Paul offered the best price of all the vendors we looked at and also provided excellent results. The yearbook had a very small staff, so we very much appreciated Paul's aggressive email marketing campaigns to students to encourage them to get their senior pictures taken. A record number of students ended up coming in for senior pictures that year, and I didn't hear of any complaints. Paul was also extremely attentive, constantly offering to help us with marketing, selling yearbooks, working with university administrators, and generally emphasizing the flexibility of his company's services. I ended up forging a personal relationship with Paul that I have maintained two years later. I highly recommend Paul and Lauren Studios for anyone seeking a professional photography company.

summary: Graduated from Stanford University in December of 2011 with a co-terminal master's degree in civil engineering and a bachelor's in international relations. At BASIS.ed, I served as the lead coordinator of efforts to open new BASIS charter schools nationwide. Now I'm running as a Republican for Superintendent of Public Instruction to restore trust in the office, promote innovation, and advocate for all 1.1 million students in Arizona.
name: Jonathan Gelbart
title: Candidate for Arizona Superintendent of Public Instruction
